Package design.aeonic.nifty.api.client.screen.drawable

Class Drawables

java.lang.Object
design.aeonic.nifty.api.client.screen.drawable.Drawables
public final class Drawables extends Object
Contains some drawables for ease of use - recipe arrows, an empty container gui, item slots, etc. Some have more advanced functionality via Drawable's context parameter, but these can be converted to a StaticDrawable via Drawable.with(Supplier).

  • Field Details

    • EMPTY_CONTAINER

      public static final Texture EMPTY_CONTAINER
      An empty container background, like a chest - has only the player inventory slots drawn.

    • ITEM_SLOT

      public static final Texture ITEM_SLOT
      A vanilla item slot, 18x18.

    • ITEM_SLOT_OUTPUT

      public static final Texture ITEM_SLOT_OUTPUT
      A larger vanilla item slot, such as the crafting table output. 26x26.

    • RECIPE_ARROW_NORMAL

      public static final Texture RECIPE_ARROW_NORMAL
      A static recipe arrow, like that used in the crafting table.

    • RECIPE_ARROW_FILL

      public static final Texture RECIPE_ARROW_FILL
      The white-filled recipe arrow, like that drawn over a furnace gui. For a filling arrow, use RECIPE_ARROW_FILLING.

    • RECIPE_ARROW_DISALLOWED

      public static final Texture RECIPE_ARROW_DISALLOWED
      A static recipe arrow with a red X, like that used for unsupported recipes in an anvil.

    • RECIPE_ARROW_FILLING

      public static final FillingDrawable RECIPE_ARROW_FILLING
      A filling recipe arrow, like that used in a furnace gui.

    • FURNACE_FIRE_EMPTY

      public static final Texture FURNACE_FIRE_EMPTY
      The empty part of the burn timer used in the furnace. For a fully functional burn timer that represents lit duration, see BURN_TIMER.

    • FURNACE_FIRE_FULL

      public static final Texture FURNACE_FIRE_FULL
      The full/burning part of the burn timer used in the furnace. For a fully functional burn timer that represents lit duration, see BURN_TIMER.

    • BURN_TIMER

      public static final FillingDrawable BURN_TIMER
      A burn time indicator like that used in the furnace. Ticks down based on the passed context, which is inverted by the drawable. For basic use, see FillingDrawable.with(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.Float>) - you'll generally just want Progress.of(Supplier, Supplier) ie BURN_TIMER.with(Progress.of(() -> litTime, () -> litDuration))
